}

but I’m not sure if its being called?

item.title: Help with deleting objects please
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

No.

You Fill Out Object’sXCoord And Object’sYCoord With The X and Y’s.

deleteObject(4312, 1243);

You have to incase it in a method, and call it from somewhere, like so:

public void callDelObj() {
deleteObject(4312, 1243);
}

And Put:

callDelObj in that case where it is called everytime it says loading please wait, or in intialize method, so that the objects are loaded as soon as you login, and never called again, unless you login again.(Could lead to some problems, but its ok).

I suggest add in the method that calls your:

makeGlobalObject shit.

It doesn’t matter, just put it under there.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with deleting objects please
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

deleteObject(Object’sXCoord, Object’sYCoord);

SO fill in with where the object is located, its X and Y Coordinates.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with deleting objects please
item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

I have this void… but I need a little help since I quit coding for 3 months

[code]
public void deleteObject(int objectX, int objectY)

            {

	outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(60);
	outStream.writeByte(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
	outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));
	/*DELETE OBJECT*/
	outStream.writeByte(101);
	outStream.writeByteC(0);
	outStream.writeByte(0);
            }[/code]

Read full topic
